intro: Amyrea lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved amyrea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Amyrea lancifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
